io.netty.channel

Class ChannelInboundByteHandlerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundByteHandlerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundByteHandler, ChannelStateHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ByteToByteDecoder, ByteToMessageDecoder, SpdyOrHttpChooser

    public abstract class ChannelInboundByteHandlerAdapter
extends ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
implements ChannelInboundByteHandler
    Abstract base class for ChannelInboundByteHandler which should be extended by the user to get notified once more data is ready to get consumed from the inbound ByteBuf. This implementation is a good starting point for most users.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

    • Method Detail

      • newInboundBuffer

        public ByteBuf newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                         throws Exception
        Create a new unpooled ByteBuf by default. Sub-classes may override this to offer a more optimized implementation.
        Specified by:
        newInboundBuffer in interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • discardInboundReadBytes

        public void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption. The most common implementation of this method will look like the following: 
             ctx.inboundByteBuffer().discardSomeReadBytes();
        Specified by:
        discardInboundReadBytes in interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • inboundBufferUpdated

        public final void inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                                throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelStateHandler
        The inbound buffer of the ChannelHandlerContext was updated with new data. This means something may be ready to get processed by the actual ChannelStateHandler implementation. It's up to the implementation to consume it or keep it in the buffer to wait for more data and consume it later.
        Specified by:
        inboundBufferUpdated in interface ChannelStateHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • inboundBufferUpdated

        protected abstract void inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                        ByteBuf in)
                                      throws Exception
        Callback which will get notifed once the given ByteBuf received more data to read. What will be done with the data at this point is up to the implementation. Implementations may choose to read it or just let it in the buffer to read it later.
        Throws:
        Exception
